sentences.sentence: The international community slams Netanyahu over plans of an all-ground assault on Rafah, where 1.5 million people are crammed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Israel is facing growing international pressure over its intentions to launch an all-out military assault on the city of Rafah in southern Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: With more than 1.5 million people now crammed into the city, promises from Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of evacuating civilians have been slammed by Joseph Bourre, the EU's foreign policy chief.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.sentence: DAVID CAMERON, UK Foreign Secretary to the UK, Really, we think, is impossible to see how you can fight a war amongst these people. There's nowhere for them to go. They can't go south into Egypt, they can't go north and back to their homes because many have been destroyed." Whilst Netanyahu has been focusing on the successful rescue of two Israeli hostages from Gaza, he's been congratulating the soldiers who mounted the dramatic operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Israel's military has released footage of the rescue, showing the moment the soldiers moved in to extract the two men.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least 67 Palestinians were killed in support airstrikes launched nearby the rescue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: With Israel believing Rafah and southern Gaza are Hamas strongholds, hostilities continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The WHO say hospitals are overwhelmed and under-supplied. Over 20,000 people are sheltering in the European Gaza hospital, with no safe place to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin has put Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas on its wanted list, as tensions between Russia and the West soar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Kalas is a staunch supporter of Ukraine and has consistently called for more military support for Kyiv and tougher sanctions against Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The Interior Ministry did not initially specify the charges against her, but a spokesperson said they related to the desecration of historical memory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Estonian State Secretary Taimar Petrkov and Lithuanian Culture Minister Simonas Kairis have also been added to the list.

sentences.sentence: Both Baltic countries have toppled Soviet monuments since Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: The governments of Poland, France and Germany have vowed to make Europe a security and defence power with a greater ability to back Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the message new Prime Minister Donald Tusk took to both Paris and Berlin as he tries to revitalise his nation's relations with key European partners.

sentences.sentence: His diplomatic push comes after Trump shocked many in Europe over the weekend by appearing to invite Russia to invade any NATO member, not spending enough on its own defense.

sentences.sentence: On Monday, Moldovan farmers blocked the main gateway road to Romania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The Farmers' Force Association is protesting against diesel fuel donations from Romania and insufficient government subsidies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: They say farmers need help to alleviate the losses suffered in the last two years, and an injection of government cash is needed or there will be no spring sowing of crops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, in Poland, farmers spilled Ukrainian grain on the road as part of their latest protest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The country has been hit hard by the introduction of so-called solidarity corridors to facilitate food exports from Ukraine after Russia invaded the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Instead of transiting further, much of the Ukrainian produce is stuck on the national market, causing a decline in the demand and prices for local Polish production.

sentences.sentence: The head of the United Nations' nuclear watchdog warned on Tuesday that Iran is not being, quote, entirely transparent regarding its atomic program.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The warning comes after the announcement by a former head of Tehran's program that the country has, quote, in its minds all the parts needed to make a weapon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Scaffolding and shrouding at the summit of Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral, has been removed after nearly five years of reconstruction following a devastating fire, revealing the newly implanted spire, golden rooster and cross that adorn it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While much of the cathedral remains surrounded by scaffolding, the last few months has seen remarkable progress on the rebuilding, putting it well on track for a December 8th reopening.

sentences.sentence: On specific areas I would put strategic enablers, for instance, or these strategic capabilities that are very much needed at EU level, such as strategic transport capabilities, satellite capabilities, maritime and air awareness, then at the same time joint logistics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But military expenditure by EU member states is significant. It was 240 billion euros in 2022, almost the same as China and more than double Russia. One issue is cohesiveness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to the European Defence Agency, EU states only spend 20% of their procurement budgets on collective defence equipment. How this money is spent is crucial, with a dilemma between short and long-term needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: On short-term needs, of course, we need to replenish ammunition and capabilities and to urgently buy new capabilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But at the same time, we need to also look on the long term, which is developing these European capabilities that we hear about in the press and in decisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Building an EU army through a defence union, as some have suggested, seems impossible at this stage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But there is scope for enhanced interoperability, procurement and delivery of weapons at European level. Some steps have already been taken, like a law to finance EU budget ammunition production called ASAP, or the creation of a rapid deployment capacity of up to 5,000 soldiers for peacekeeping missions across the world. However, other measures are urgently required.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: When you have a war of aggression in Europe against Ukraine, when you have hybrid war by Russia against EU member states, this is the moment not to wage war, but to deter the risk of an aggression against one of us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So if not now, I don't know when the European defence will really start to be seriously taken into consideration." One suggestion supported by French government is an EU bond to finance military expenditure.
